subject: RE: [junit] Flexible assertions with AssertThat
msgSnippet: Tony, We have no plans to incorporate AssertThat in JUnit. I think it is an interesting idea, but I am not convinced that the additional expressive power is
messageBody:
Tony,

We have no plans to incorporate AssertThat in JUnit. I think it is an
interesting idea, but I am not convinced that the additional expressive
power is worth the additional complexity. One area where it could help is in
automatically generating helpful error messages.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Tony Gunter
> Sent: Thursday, December 01, 2005 8:39 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Flexible assertions with AssertThat
>
>
> Before I write my own "AssertThat," are there any plans to
> incorporate
> Joe Walnes' suggestion into JUnit in the future?
